trans-unit.source: Getting started with the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Getting started with the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: This is the Azure Multi-factor authentication page that describes how to get started with Azure MFA Server.
trans-unit.target: This is the Azure Multi-factor authentication page that describes how to get started with Azure MFA Server.

trans-unit.source: Getting started with the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Getting started with the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: Cloud
trans-unit.target: Cloud

trans-unit.source: Now that we have determined whether to use on-premises multi-factor authentication, lets get going.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have determined whether to use on-premises multi-factor authentication, lets get going.

trans-unit.source: This page covers a new installation of the server and getting it setup with on-premises Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This page covers a new installation of the server and getting it setup with on-premises Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: If you already have the Phonefactor server installed and are looking for how to do this see Upgrading to the Azure Multi-Factor Server or if you are looking for information on installing just the web service see Deploying the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server Mobile App Web Service.
trans-unit.target: If you already have the Phonefactor server installed and are looking for how to do this see Upgrading to the Azure Multi-Factor Server or if you are looking for information on installing just the web service see Deploying the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server Mobile App Web Service.

trans-unit.source: Download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: There are two different ways that you can download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server.
trans-unit.target: There are two different ways that you can download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server.

trans-unit.source: Both are done via the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Both are done via the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The first is by managing the Multi-Factor Auth Provider directly.
trans-unit.target: The first is by managing the Multi-Factor Auth Provider directly.

trans-unit.source: The second is via the service settings.
trans-unit.target: The second is via the service settings.

trans-unit.source: The second option requires either a Multi-Factor Auth Provider or an Azure AD Premium license.
trans-unit.target: The second option requires either a Multi-Factor Auth Provider or an Azure AD Premium license.

trans-unit.source: To download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication server from the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication server from the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure Portal as an Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure Portal as an Administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the left, select Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: On the left, select Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: On the Active Directory page, at the top click **Multi-Factor Auth Providers**
trans-unit.target: On the Active Directory page, at the top click **Multi-Factor Auth Providers**

trans-unit.source: At the bottom click **Manage**
trans-unit.target: At the bottom click **Manage**

trans-unit.source: This will open a new page.
trans-unit.target: This will open a new page.

trans-unit.source: Click **Downloads.**
trans-unit.target: Click **Downloads.**

trans-unit.source: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-sdk/download.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-sdk/download.png)

trans-unit.source: Above **Generate Activation Credentials**, click **Download.**
trans-unit.target: Above **Generate Activation Credentials**, click **Download.**

trans-unit.source: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-get-started-server/download4.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-get-started-server/download4.png)

trans-unit.source: Save the download.
trans-unit.target: Save the download.

trans-unit.source: To download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server via the service settings
trans-unit.target: To download the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server via the service settings

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure Portal as an Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure Portal as an Administrator.

trans-unit.source: On the left, select Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: On the left, select Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Double click on your instance of Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Double click on your instance of Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: At the top click **Configure**
trans-unit.target: At the top click **Configure**

trans-unit.source: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-sdk/download2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-sdk/download2.png)

trans-unit.source: Under multi-factor authentication select **Manage service settings**
trans-unit.target: Under multi-factor authentication select **Manage service settings**

trans-unit.source: On the services settings page, at the bottom of the screen click **Go to the portal**.
trans-unit.target: On the services settings page, at the bottom of the screen click **Go to the portal**.

trans-unit.source: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-sdk/download3.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Download](./media/multi-factor-authentication-sdk/download3.png)

trans-unit.source: This will open a new page.
trans-unit.target: This will open a new page.

trans-unit.source: Click **Downloads.**
trans-unit.target: Click **Downloads.**

trans-unit.source: Above **Generate Activation Credentials**, click **Download.**
trans-unit.target: Above **Generate Activation Credentials**, click **Download.**

trans-unit.source: Save the download.
trans-unit.target: Save the download.

trans-unit.source: Install and Configure the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Install and Configure the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: Now that you have downloaded the server you can install it and configure it.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have downloaded the server you can install it and configure it.

trans-unit.source: Be sure that the server you are installing it on meets the following requirements:
trans-unit.target: Be sure that the server you are installing it on meets the following requirements:

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server Requirements
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server Requirements

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Hardware
trans-unit.target: Hardware

trans-unit.source: 200 MB of hard disk space
trans-unit.target: 200 MB of hard disk space

trans-unit.source: x32 or x64 capable processor
trans-unit.target: x32 or x64 capable processor

trans-unit.source: 1 GB or greater RAM
trans-unit.target: 1 GB or greater RAM

trans-unit.source: Software
trans-unit.target: Software

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2003 or greater if the host is a server OS
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2003 or greater if the host is a server OS

trans-unit.source: Windows Vista or greater if the host is a client OS
trans-unit.target: Windows Vista or greater if the host is a client OS

trans-unit.source: Microsoft .NET 2.0 Framework
trans-unit.target: Microsoft .NET 2.0 Framework

trans-unit.source: IIS 6.0 or greater if installing the user portal or web service SDK
trans-unit.target: IIS 6.0 or greater if installing the user portal or web service SDK

trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server firewall requirements
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server firewall requirements

trans-unit.source: Each MFA server must be able to communicate on port 443 outbound to the following:
trans-unit.target: Each MFA server must be able to communicate on port 443 outbound to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://pfd.phonefactor.net
trans-unit.target: https://pfd.phonefactor.net

trans-unit.source: https://pfd2.phonefactor.net
trans-unit.target: https://pfd2.phonefactor.net

trans-unit.source: https://css.phonefactor.net
trans-unit.target: https://css.phonefactor.net

trans-unit.source: If outbound firewalls are restricted on port 443, the following IP address ranges will need to be opened:
trans-unit.target: If outbound firewalls are restricted on port 443, the following IP address ranges will need to be opened:

trans-unit.source: IP Subnet
trans-unit.target: IP Subnet

trans-unit.source: Netmask
trans-unit.target: Netmask

trans-unit.source: IP Range
trans-unit.target: IP Range

trans-unit.source: If you are not using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Event Confirmation features and if users are not authenticating with the Multi-Factor Auth mobile apps from devices on the corporate network the IP ranges can be reduced to the following:
trans-unit.target: If you are not using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Event Confirmation features and if users are not authenticating with the Multi-Factor Auth mobile apps from devices on the corporate network the IP ranges can be reduced to the following:

trans-unit.source: IP Subnet
trans-unit.target: IP Subnet

trans-unit.source: Netmask
trans-unit.target: Netmask

trans-unit.source: IP Range
trans-unit.target: IP Range

trans-unit.source: To install and configure the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication server
trans-unit.target: To install and configure the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication server

trans-unit.source: Double-click on the executable.
trans-unit.target: Double-click on the executable.

trans-unit.source: This will begin the installation.
trans-unit.target: This will begin the installation.

trans-unit.source: On the Select Installation Folder screen, make sure that the folder is correct and click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Select Installation Folder screen, make sure that the folder is correct and click Next.

trans-unit.source: Once the installation complete, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: Once the installation complete, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: This will launch the configuration wizard.
trans-unit.target: This will launch the configuration wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the configuration wizard welcome screen, place a check in **Skip using the Authentication Configuration Wizard** and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the configuration wizard welcome screen, place a check in **Skip using the Authentication Configuration Wizard** and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: This will close the wizard and start the server.
trans-unit.target: This will close the wizard and start the server.

trans-unit.source: ![Cloud](./media/multi-factor-authentication-get-started-server/skip2.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Cloud](./media/multi-factor-authentication-get-started-server/skip2.png)

trans-unit.source: Back on the page that we downloaded the server from, click the **Generate Activation Credentials** button.
trans-unit.target: Back on the page that we downloaded the server from, click the **Generate Activation Credentials** button.

trans-unit.source: Copy this information into the Azure MFA Server in the boxes provided and click **Activate**.
trans-unit.target: Copy this information into the Azure MFA Server in the boxes provided and click **Activate**.

trans-unit.source: The above steps show an express setup with the configuration wizard.
trans-unit.target: The above steps show an express setup with the configuration wizard.

trans-unit.source: You can re-run the authentication wizard by selecting it from the Tools menu on the server.
trans-unit.target: You can re-run the authentication wizard by selecting it from the Tools menu on the server.

trans-unit.source: Import users from Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Import users from Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Now that the server is installed and configured you can quickly import users into the Azure MFA Server.
trans-unit.target: Now that the server is installed and configured you can quickly import users into the Azure MFA Server.

trans-unit.source: To import users from Active Directory
trans-unit.target: To import users from Active Directory

trans-unit.source: In the Azure MFA Server, on the left, select **Users**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure MFA Server, on the left, select **Users**.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom, select **Import from Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom, select **Import from Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Now you can either search for individual users or search the AD directory for OUs with users in them.
trans-unit.target: Now you can either search for individual users or search the AD directory for OUs with users in them.

trans-unit.source: In this case, we will specify the users OU.
trans-unit.target: In this case, we will specify the users OU.

trans-unit.source: Highlight all of the users on the right and click **Import**.
trans-unit.target: Highlight all of the users on the right and click **Import**.

trans-unit.source: You should receive a pop-up telling you that you were successful.
trans-unit.target: You should receive a pop-up telling you that you were successful.

trans-unit.source: Close the import window.
trans-unit.target: Close the import window.

trans-unit.source: Cloud
trans-unit.target: Cloud

trans-unit.source: Send Users an email
trans-unit.target: Send Users an email

trans-unit.source: Now that you have imported your users into the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication server, it is advised that you send your users an email that informs them that they have been enrolled in multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have imported your users into the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication server, it is advised that you send your users an email that informs them that they have been enrolled in multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: With the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server there are various ways to configure your users for using multi-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server there are various ways to configure your users for using multi-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: For instance, if you know the users’ phone numbers or were able to import the phone numbers into the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server from their company’s directory, the email will let users know that they have been configured to use Azure Multi-Factor Authentication, provide some instructions on using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and inform the user of the phone number they will receive their authentications on.
trans-unit.target: For instance, if you know the users’ phone numbers or were able to import the phone numbers into the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server from their company’s directory, the email will let users know that they have been configured to use Azure Multi-Factor Authentication, provide some instructions on using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and inform the user of the phone number they will receive their authentications on.

trans-unit.source: The content of the email will vary depending on the method of authentication that has been set for the user (e.g. phone call, SMS, mobile app).
trans-unit.target: The content of the email will vary depending on the method of authentication that has been set for the user (e.g. phone call, SMS, mobile app).

trans-unit.source: For example, if the user is required to use a PIN when they authenticate, the email will tell them what their initial PIN has been set to.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the user is required to use a PIN when they authenticate, the email will tell them what their initial PIN has been set to.

trans-unit.source: Users are usually required to change their PIN during their first authentication.
trans-unit.target: Users are usually required to change their PIN during their first authentication.

trans-unit.source: If users’ phone numbers have not been configured or imported into the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server, or users are pre-configured to use the mobile app for authentication, you can send them an email that lets them know that they have been configured to use Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and it will direct them to complete their account enrollment through the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication User Portal.
trans-unit.target: If users’ phone numbers have not been configured or imported into the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication Server, or users are pre-configured to use the mobile app for authentication, you can send them an email that lets them know that they have been configured to use Azure Multi-Factor Authentication and it will direct them to complete their account enrollment through the Azure Multi-Factor Authentication User Portal.

trans-unit.source: A hyperlink will be included that the user clicks on to access the User Portal.
trans-unit.target: A hyperlink will be included that the user clicks on to access the User Portal.

trans-unit.source: When the user clicks on the hyperlink, their web browser will open and take them to their company’s Azure Multi-Factor Authentication User Portal.
trans-unit.target: When the user clicks on the hyperlink, their web browser will open and take them to their company’s Azure Multi-Factor Authentication User Portal.

trans-unit.source: Configuring email and email templates
trans-unit.target: Configuring email and email templates

trans-unit.source: By clicking on the email icon on the left you can setup the settings for sending these emails.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on the email icon on the left you can setup the settings for sending these emails.

trans-unit.source: This is where you can enter the SMTP information of your mail server and it allows you to send a blanket wide email by adding a check to the Send mails to users check box.
trans-unit.target: This is where you can enter the SMTP information of your mail server and it allows you to send a blanket wide email by adding a check to the Send mails to users check box.

trans-unit.source: Email Settings
trans-unit.target: Email Settings

trans-unit.source: On the Email Content tab, you will see all of the various email templates that are available to choose from.
trans-unit.target: On the Email Content tab, you will see all of the various email templates that are available to choose from.

trans-unit.source: So depending on how you have configured your users to use multi-factor authentication, you can choose the template that best suits you.
trans-unit.target: So depending on how you have configured your users to use multi-factor authentication, you can choose the template that best suits you.

trans-unit.source: Email templates
trans-unit.target: Email templates
